content.question:
Reaction 1:
 <math alttext="V with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus 2 electrons produce V solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>V(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="E naught equals negative 1.18 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Reaction 2:
 <math alttext="P b with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus 2 electrons produce P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Pb(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="E naught equals negative 0.13 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Net Reaction:
 <math alttext="V solid plus P b with a positive 2 charge aqueous react to produce P b solid plus V with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>V(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Pb(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

The vanadium-lead galvanic cell in the diagram above initially operates under standard conditions according to the net reaction shown in the table below the diagram. The cell operates for 1.0 minute at a constant known current. Which of the following mathematical relationships would be most useful for determining the change in mass of the <math alttext="V solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>V</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> electrode after 1.0 minute of the cell's operation without having to use a balance?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub cell equals E naught sub cell, minus the fraction R T over n F, end fraction, times the natural log of Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>ln</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught equals negative n F E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>n</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>F</mi><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta G naught equals delta H naught minus T delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
